pull.title: qa: Fix `wallet_multiwallet.py`
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/31409.

The first commit prevents possible false positives by ensuring that each condition potentially causing the "Error scanning" log message is tested separately.

The second commit disables a problematic check on Windows.

verification.payload:
tree 131cd6f0c27c1164e5863779f05e45a26ac7522e
parent fd8d7c367f69e8c78ff7eabe59b705442c68d58c
author Hennadii Stepanov <32963518+hebasto@users.noreply.github.com> 1733237112 +0000

qa: Disable self-symlink test on Windows and document it

events.message: qa: Disable self-symlink test on Windows and document it

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -129,15 +126,23 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         for wallet_name in to_load:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
 
+        # Tests for possible scanning errors:
+        # 1. "Permission denied" error.
         os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
         os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
comments.body: Would it be possible to achieve the same with `icacls` on Windows?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -129,15 +126,23 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         for wallet_name in to_load:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
 
+        # Tests for possible scanning errors:
+        # 1. "Permission denied" error.
         os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
         os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)

@@ -129,15 +126,23 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         for wallet_name in to_load:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
 
+        # Tests for possible scanning errors:
+        # 1. "Permission denied" error.
         os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
         os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
comments.body: I'm not sure if testing the scenario with the modified ACL on Windows is worth the added complexity of the test script.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -129,14 +126,23 @@ def wallet_file(name):
         for wallet_name in to_load:
             self.nodes[0].loadwallet(wallet_name)
 
-        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
-        os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
-        try:
-            with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Error scanning']):
-                walletlist = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets']
-        finally:
-            # Need to ensure access is restored for cleanup
-            os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), stat.S_IRUSR | stat.S_IWUSR | stat.S_IXUSR)
+        # Tests for possible scanning errors:
+        # 1. "Permission denied" error.
+        if platform.system() != 'Windows' and os.geteuid() != 0:
+            os.mkdir(wallet_dir('no_access'))
+            os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), 0)
+            try:
+                with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Error scanning']):
+                    walletlist = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets']
+            finally:
+                # Need to ensure access is restored for cleanup
+                os.chmod(wallet_dir('no_access'), stat.S_IRUSR | stat.S_IWUSR | stat.S_IXUSR)
+            assert_equal(sorted(map(lambda w: w['name'], walletlist)), sorted(in_wallet_dir))
+        # 2. "Too many levels of symbolic links" error.
+        os.mkdir(wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink'))
+        os.symlink('wallet.dat', wallet_dir('self_walletdat_symlink/wallet.dat'))
+        with self.nodes[0].assert_debug_log(expected_msgs=['Error scanning']):
+            walletlist = self.nodes[0].listwalletdir()['wallets']
comments.body: Could do a third listwalletdir without the symlink to check that the test is working by checking for absence of `error scanning`?
